LightningComponentBundle.description: This component allows you to provide a custom file upload that upon completion of the upload will display the file underneath it

property.name: recordId
property.label: Related Record Id
property.description: Provide the parent Id that you wish to associate your uploaded File/s with.

property.name: fileUploadLabel
property.label: File Upload Label
property.description: This is the label for your file upload button.

property.name: uploadedlabel
property.label: Uploaded File List Label
property.description: The text on the list of files uploaded.

property.name: acceptedFormats
property.label: Accepted Formats
property.description: The accepted file types. Enter a comma-separated list of the file extensions (such as .jpg,.pdf,.xlsx,.docx)

property.name: allowMultipleFiles
property.label: Allow Multiple Files
property.description: Allow the user to upload multiple files. If this is not TRUE, then once the user uploads one file, the file upload component will not allow any additional files to be uploaded.

property.name: existingFileIds
property.label: Existing File Ids
property.description: This is a collection(text) of ContentDocumentId that have already been uploaded.

property.name: required
property.label: Required
property.description: Require the user to upload at least one file.

property.name: showUploadButton
property.label: Show Upload Button
property.description: If you want to dynamically display this button dependant on if the form is now in readonly mode set this to false, when set to true the button will display. The button is still disable automatically in some cases.

property.name: requiredValidationMessage
property.label: Required Validation Message
property.description: When component is configured that files are required, this is the message that will display to the user if they do not perform the action. This message will only display when they attempt to navigation to the next screen or finish the flow.

property.name: overrideConfiguration
property.label: File Configuration
property.description: This is the configuration that you created in meta data, specify the DeveloperAPIName for the Metadata record which will contain your custom configuration

property.name: disableFileDelete
property.label: Disable File Deletion
property.description: When this is TRUE the X next to the file will not be available.

property.name: helpText
property.label: Help Text
property.description: The message that will be displayed in the help text popup.
